qas.question: What was the name of the single piece of work he wrote in 1844?
What can be said of these works compared to his work in other years even though the quantity was less?

answers.text: more refined than many of his earlier compositions

qas.question: How many pieces did Chopin write in 1841?
How many pieces did Chopin compose in 1842?
What piece did Chopin compose in 1844?
How many works did Chopin write in 1842?
How many works did Chopin write in 1843?
How many works did Chopin write in 1845?

context: Chopin's output as a composer throughout this period declined in quantity year by year. Whereas in 1841 he had written <a2_0>a dozen<a2_0/> works, only <a3_0><a5_0>six<a5_0/><a3_0/> were written in 1842 and <a6_0>six shorter pieces<a6_0/> in 1843. In 1844 he wrote only the <a0_0><a4_0>Op. 58 sonata<a4_0/><a0_0/>. 1845 saw the completion of <a7_0>three mazurkas<a7_0/> (Op. 59). Although these works were <a1_0>more refined than many of his earlier compositions<a1_0/>, Zamoyski opines that "his powers of concentration were failing and his inspiration was beset by anguish, both emotional and intellectual."
